t: Proverbs 9
Invitations of Wisdom and Folly
Wisdom*pn has built her house; she*ld has set up its seven pillars.
She*ln has prepared her meat and mixed her wine; she*ld has also set her table.
She*ln has sent out her servants, and she calls from*ld the highest point of the city,
“Let*ld all who are simple come to my house!” To*ln those who have no sense she says,
“Come,*ld eat my food and*ld drink the wine I have mixed.
Leave*ln your simple ways and you will live; walk*ld in the way of insight.”
Whoever*pn corrects a mocker invites insults; whoever*ld rebukes the wicked incurs abuse.
Do*ln not rebuke mockers or they will hate you; rebuke*ld the wise and they will love you.
Instruct*ln the wise and they will be wiser still; teach*ld the righteous and they will add to their learning.
The*pn fear of the Lord*s is the beginning of wisdom, and*ld knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
For*ln through wisdom your days will be many, and*ld years will be added to your life.
If*ln you are wise, your wisdom will reward you; if*ld you are a mocker, you alone will suffer.
Folly*pn is an unruly woman; she*ld is simple and knows nothing.
She*ln sits at the door of her house, on*ld a seat at the highest point of the city,
calling*ln out to those who pass by, who*ld go straight on their way,
“Let*ld all who are simple come to my house!” To*ln those who have no sense she says,
“Stolen*ld water is sweet; food*ld eaten in secret is delicious!”
But*ln little do they know that the dead are there, that*ld her guests are deep in the realm of the dead.
